$npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, can you decipher the runes engraved on the gate? I'd prefer to avoid any surprises.
Piece of cake! Let's see...
"Despair all who enter here..."
"Madrakan... the Fortress of Fury."
She went to such lengths to hide this place, and then wrote this flashy message on the front gate.
Likely to inspire dread in those who behold it. Had Madria's attack succeeded, she would likely have brought any prisoners here as slaves, like at Katramus.
This message was probably meant for them.
Madrakan... the Fortress of Fury. She obviously named it after herself.
She's awfully full of herself.
We'll cure that with the destruction of her fortress.
$npcName:11003135[gender:0]$, return to headquarters and update everyone on what has occurred here. $npcName:11003091[gender:1]$, you should return to the Foundation as well.
Excuse me?

You have already expended an immense amount of mana. According to $npcName:11004032[gender:0]$, further exertion in your state could prove life-threatening. Don't worry. The royal court has many mages at its disposal.
Hehe... then you'll have to excuse me. I'm off to recover my magic! Perhaps at that hot spring...
I am not giving you license to derelict your duties. Return to $map:52010068$ and coordinate with the Foundation to develop a battle plan.
Hmph... Fine.
The mission is simple. Break through Madrakan's rampart, forge our way through the castle interior, and conquer its spire. I'm counting on you to lead us to victory.
The mission is simple. Break through Madrakan's rampart, forge our way through the castle interior, and conquer its spire. I'm counting on you to lead us to victory.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Thanks to your efforts we were able to minimize our casualties in the siege upon Madrakan. Madria's fortress is on the verge of falling.
However, Madrakan's spire yet stands. Our mages report that a powerful magical seal stands between us and surmounting the spire.
The quickest way to undo the seals is to find and eliminate the source of their power.
I've been told that the spell that bars our way is no ordinary seal, but one fueled by an old grudge from long ago.
To learn any more about this grudge and how to settle it, we require the aid of an expert mage.

To that end, I want you to return to the Frontier Foundation and report what we've learned. Surely Orde or Lanemone will know a way to break the seal. I will stand guard here and monitor the situation.
What? Seal? A seal powered by an intense grudge?
A grudge you say? Hmm...
Wait, do you know something about this?
Wait, do you know something about this?
Well, if it is Madria's grudge powering the spell, I might know a little about the circumstances. It happened long ago, and few still remember the tale...
Miss... You don't mean...
Yes. It's a very sad story.
I was told the story so long ago it almost seems a fairy tale... There are bits and pieces lost to time, but I'll tell you what I know.
The Madria family was a powerful noble family that once did business with the Alemani family. The only daughter of the household was also named Madria.
An unknown plague swept through the Madria manor, afflicting not only the servants of the household, but young Madria as well.
An unknown plague swept through the Madria manor, afflicting not only the servants of the household, but young Madria as well.

Madria's father exhausted great resources hiring numerous doctors and trying all manner of cures, all to no avail. Eventually, he requested the aid of the royal court. What happened after that is a bit unclear, but...
Some time later it was reported the manor was completely empty. No occupants, not even a corpse. Those who visited are said to have felt deeply uneasy. The manor has been abandoned to this day.
There are rumors the place is haunted and that Madria's father still stalks its halls, cursing the royal court for forsaking his household.
I believe that this is the grudge that fuels the seal our forces encountered.
I believe if we travel to the source of that grudge, we will find the casting site of our seal.

Finding the source is the easy part... We have to reach back across time and manifest the rage, loathing and anguish of the Madria family in the present where we can fight it. The myriad magics required for such a feat would be...
Can you cast a spell like that?
Are you crazy? It's impossible!
Forget all the intricate spellweaving entailed—we'd need an object with a psychic connection to Madria, a catalyst with a huge amount of magical potential. Where would we ever find something like...
Wait! The blackshard! It was created by Madria's dragon...
But we'd still need a tremendous amount of mana...
What about your mana? Aren't you a super powerful mage?
I'm not that powerful! The amount of mana we're talking about, we'd need two Master Wizards on my level to even have a chance of success!
I believe there's a Master Wizard standing right over there...
Eh? You want me to work with her?! Yeah right. Good luck convincing her to help!
<font size='15'>...I'll do it.</font>
What?
<font size='40'>I said I'll help you cast the stupid spell!</font>
It's not like I have a choice! I don't wanna be the girl responsible for letting the world be destroyed.
...Hmph. Then I guess we're working together.
A-alright, fine! If you feed me a steady flow of mana, I'll handle the spell.
Well then, let's get started! $npcName:11003091[gender:1]$, get ready!
Just worry about yourself!
Grr... Ahem. $MyPCName$, we're going to be sending you to a sort-of between-place. You need to destroy the manifested psychic energy powering the seal—preferably without dying!
I'm ready when you are!
<font size='50'>Then here we go! Orde?!</font>
I'm on it!
<font color="#909090">(The room begins to swirl around you, its colors stretching into infinity...)</font> <font size="18">Urk... Everything's... wibbly-wobbly...</font>
Is the spell working?
You're back! You don't know how worried I was!
Oh thank goodness that worked! I've never physically teleported someone while at the same time projecting their consciousness onto the psychic plane...
There were a million ways that could have gone terribly wrong, but I'm very glad that it didn't! Hey... you were already bleeding from your ears before, right?
Ugh... <font color="#909090">(You feel as though you've just emerged from a spin-cycle in a washing machine—bruised in body and spirit, and quite a bit disoriented.)</font>
You mean... $MyPCName$ could have been killed...? <font color="#909090">(Beatrice begins to faint. Thankfully, her loyal butler steps forward to catch her.)</font>
M-miss! Are you all right?!
Ah... I... I'm fine, Pemberton. Now, $MyPCName$, please tell us what happened in that other place.
<font color="#909090">(You tell everyone what happened in the $map:52100041$.)</font>
I wonder how it was that Madria went from being a sickly little girl to one of the Seven Commanders...
Now that we've destroyed the source of it's power, the seal at Madrakan should have collapsed, should it not?
You are correct, miss. We have just received news that the seal protecting the citadel's spire is no more.
Then it's time to deal the fatal blow!
Go forth, my champion! Lead the final assault on Madrakan!
And...
Please return safely...
Just say the word and I'll create a spatial distortion to teleport you to the front line at Madrakan!
Let's do this.
Just say the word and I'll create a spatial distortion to teleport you to the front line at Madrakan!
You're back, and the seal upon Madrakan Spire is no more. I trust this was your doing?
Then we will begin our full-scale assault the moment preparations are complete.
$MyPCName$, I look forward to your exploits in our final assault on Madrakan.
Preparations for the siege on Madrakan Spire are complete. Are you ready?
I'm ready.
I don't think I'm ready for this...
Good, because the safety of Maple World is in our hands.
Good luck in there, $MyPCName$. We'll go in first and lead the charge. See you at the top of the spire!
Try not to die in there, all right?
Sir, why don't you focus on looking after yourself? $MyPCName$ will be just fine!
Your nagging will be the death of me. But seriously, $MyPCName$, I'm sure you'll do great. Good luck!
All right, soldiers, rally up! The time has come to strike at the heart of the enemy stronghold! I needn't tell you what's at stake. Stand together, and fight well!
What are you saying? You've made it this far! Steel your resolve, $MyPCName$. The future of Maple World is in our hands!
We'll lead the charge and carve a path through the enemy ranks. You can bring up the rear and deliver assistance wherever needed.
Good luck, $MyPCName$. See you at the top of the spire.
Try not to die in there, all right?
Sir, why don't you focus on looking after yourself? $MyPCName$ will be just fine!
Your nagging will be the death of me. But seriously, $MyPCName$, I'm sure you'll do great. Good luck!
All right, soldiers, rally up! The time has come to strike at the heart of the enemy stronghold! I needn't tell you what's at stake. Stand together, and fight well!
All right, soldiers, rally up! The time has come to strike at the heart of the enemy stronghold! I needn't tell you what's at stake. Stand together, and fight well!
Thank goodness you're back from the infirmary!
Sorry if I gave anyone a scare. The doctor says I'll be just fine, as long as I don't make a habit of getting blown up.
<font color="#909090">(Pemberton cups his hand around his mouth and whispers.)</font> <font size="20">The young miss was quite worried about you, $MyPCName$.</font>
<font color="#909090">(Pemberton whispers again.)</font> <font size="20">You were unconscious for days, but the young miss refused to leave your side, or even sleep.</font>

<font color="#909090">(Pemberton whispers.)</font> <font size="20">She was deeply distraught upon learning the leaders of Terrun Calibre had vanished. The thought that she might have sent them to their deaths was more than the young lady could bear.</font
<font color="#909090">(No wonder $npcName:11004097[gender:0]$ looks so tired.)</font>
$npcName:11003884[gender:0]$, wh-what are you muttering about over there?
Nothing, Miss...
We can't give up hope that those who went missing at Madrakan are still alive. If they're out there, we have a duty to rescue them.
I agree.
$npcName:11003884[gender:0]$, any additional resources we can devote toward the search effort, we should do so immediately.
All that has already been taken care of, miss.
If $MyPCName$ survived without serious injury, then there must be other survivors. The Runeblades of Terrun Calibre are strong. There's no way they're dead.
The Frontier Foundation must do everything in its power to rescue those still lost in the rubble.
My champion, our work is not yet done.

When the dark crystal exploded, it sent blackshards flying all around Maple World. These objects are very dangerous—we have already witnessed their corrupting influence. The Frontier Foundation must recover them at once.

Secondly, there's the matter of the missing Runeblades of Terrun Calibre... Our initial rescue efforts have borne little fruit. We must redouble our efforts, and mobilize any and all remaining resources.
As the director of the Frontier Foundation, I hereby declare that these matters are our top priority. We must distribute our resources accordingly.
Of course, we cannot forget our mission of finding and acquiring the lapenshards to prevent their misuse and ensure this incident never be repeated.
We must return to ground zero of the dark crystal explosion... The $map:02000496$.
We must return to ground zero of the dark crystal explosion... The $map:02000496$.
We've got our work cut out for us.
Between locating the leaders of Terrun Calibre, recovering and quarantining the blackshards, and collecting the lapenshards, the Frontier Foundation has a profound mission to complete.
I hope you'll stand with me, until the end.
Of course. If there's anything you need, just call me.
It is time.
We must investigate the site of the dark crystal's explosion.
Your talents are needed here at the $map:02000496$. It is time you fulfilled our contract.
Your talents are needed here at the $map:02000496$. It is time you fulfilled our contract.
I knew you would come to aid me. Then let us begin the briefing. Pemberton?
Good to see you, $MyPCName$. The Foundation has worked tirelessly to establish this base of operations. Thusnelda, head of the Alemani family, was of great help in this endeavor.
To the north is the ominous crater left behind by the explosion of the dark crystal. We've taken to referring to it as the $map:02000496$.

Given the dangers posed by the scattered blackshards, we've already dispatched our most elite scouts to track them down. We set up this camp to study the nature of the blackshards, and their connection to the anomaly at the center of the blast site.
Guidance, the Lumiknights, the Royal Guard, and the mages of the royal court are already working in unison to study the lapenshards.
How can I help?
$MyPCName$, my dear champion. In carrying out missions for the Foundation, you have demonstrated great ability. There is a special assignment I would have you perform.
I would like you to investigate the anomaly at the center of the blast site, search for the missing Runeblades of Terrun Calibre, and rescue any survivors you encounter.
There is no one in whom I place greater confidence. Though this mission will likely prove perilous, I entrust its completion to you.
Rather than hear of your exploits secondhand, I have come to the $map:02000496$ to witness your feats in person.
I'll do my very best.
Of course, I would not send my kin into such dangers alone. A competent mage is here to aid you.
Isn't that right, $npcName:11004108[gender:0]$?
Of course! In addition to being handsomely compensated, I am deeply curious about the crystal at the center of the anomaly.
I'll do whatever I can to help. Shall we, $MyPCName$?
Hey, what happened to Orde?
Sigh, she was never interested in the lapenshards to begin with. The moment she got her hands on that dragon toy she'd been drooling over, she shrieked with glee and tromped off somewhere.
Besides, she consumed an enormous amount of mana anyways. I doubt she'd be of much help in her state. So leave her to play with her toys in peace.
I guess she's earned that.
Orde has washed her hands of all this. It's up to the rest of us to see this through.
As for that enormous lapenshard over there beckoning to us in all its splendor, it must be radiating an immense amount of power to cause such a storm.
My first order of business is analyzing and identifying the crystals orbiting it.
We need to understand how such a large lapenshard formed at the heart of the blast, and whether it's a threat.
Of course, I can't go with you as I have my own research to attend to.
Bring me a sample of the crystals surrounding the lapenshard so that I may analyze them.
Bring me a sample of the crystals surrounding the lapenshard so that I may analyze them.
<font color="#909090">(The sheer power radiating from the lapenshard feels oppressive.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(Wait. What's that faint sound... a voice?)</font>
Danger... Must... Flee... This place is...
<font color="#909090">(The voice seems to be emanating from the anomaly... It seems somehow familiar.)</font>
That voice... it can't be.
$npcName:11004038[gender:0]$?
Hold on, $npcName:11004038[gender:0]$! I'm coming to save you!
<font color="#909090">(The sheer power radiating from the lapenshard feels oppressive.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(Wait. What's that faint sound... a voice?)</font>
Danger... Must... Flee... This place is...
<font color="#909090">(The voice seems to be emanating from the anomaly... It seems somehow familiar.)</font>
That voice... it can't be.
<font color="#909090">(You're certain this voice belongs to your master.)</font>
Hold on, Master! I'm coming to save you!
<font color="#909090">(When you came to your senses, you found yourself somewhere entirely different.)</font>
Where am I?
<font color="#909090">(It seems you were pulled into the anomaly at the center of the blast site...)</font>
Before I go any further, I'd better tell everyone what I've found.
Before I go any further, I'd better tell everyone what I've found.
$MyPCName$! There was a brilliant light from the lapenshard at the center of the crater just a few moments before you returned. What happened?
<font color="#909090">(You want to tell Beatrice everything... But part of you wonders if what happened in that place was just a dream.)</font>
Why are you silent? Please tell me everything that happened.
Please tell me what happened inside the anomaly.
Ishura and the other leaders of Terrun Calibre are all alive.
I see! I never doubted for a moment that our Moonlight Blade had survived the explosion unharmed.
I don't know if "unharmed" is accurate.
What do you mean?
He didn't seem like himself. He seemed... Feral. Like he might attack me any instant.
A leader of Terrun Calibre would never do such a thing! They only raise their blade against injustice and evil.
I'm sure you're right, but I was transported out of that place before I could find out anything for sure.
Even if they have been altered in some way, our objective remains the same. Now that we have confirmed they are alive, it is our duty to rescue them.
I'll return to the crater.
<font size='40'>Wait! Not yet.</font>
Please tell me what happened inside the anomaly.
Ishura and the other leaders of Terrun Calibre are all alive.
I see! I never doubted for a moment that our Moonlight Blade had survived the explosion unharmed.
I don't know if "unharmed" is accurate.
What do you mean?
My master didn't seem like himself. He seemed... Feral. Like he might attack me any instant.
A leader of Terrun Calibre would never do such a thing! They only raise their blade against injustice and evil.
I'm sure you're right, but I was transported out of that place before I could find out anything for sure.
Even if they have been altered in some way, our objective remains the same. Now that we have confirmed they are alive, it is our duty to rescue them.
I'll return to the crater.
<font size='40'>Wait! Not yet.</font>
<font size='40'>Wait! Not yet.</font>
What is it, $npcName:11004108[gender:0]$?
You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment. So what if the Runeblades are alive? Before you go tromping off, you need a plan.
From the moment I arrived, I set out to study the large lapenshard at the center of the blast site. That's when I discovered it was emitting a signal.

On analysis, the signal seemed like a person's voice—but it was too garbled to make out. However, I soon realized that the signal I detected corresponded to the periodic energy bursts being emitted by the crystal.
That's weird. Have you ever seen anything like that before?
I have, in fact. I detected the very same signal when the dark crystal exploded at Madrakan.
<font size='50'>!</font>
Do you see? The dark crystal at the center of the anomaly is a blackshard.
An unknown force has drawn the fragments of the blackshards back here where they have begun to re-form.
My hypothesis is that the mysterious power drawing the fragments of the dark crystal here is that of the missing Runeblades you encountered within the crater.
But there's a more pressing issue. The signal and its corresponding energy pulse is growing stronger, and the time between pulses is decreasing.
In other words, the energy within the dark lapenshard is approaching critical mass. Eventually...
It will explode.
My initial calculations based on the accelerating energy pulses indicated that its explosion will be thousands of times more powerful than the blackshard that destroyed Madrakan.
Considering the original explosion created a dimensional rift of this magnitude in the Shadow World, imagine what will happen this time?
<font size='50'>!</font>
Maple World will be utterly annihilated.
We're sitting on a ticking time bomb here.
<font size='40'>Miss, we must evacuate immediately!</font>
Calm down, $npcName:11004107[gender:0]$. It's too soon to panic.
Besides, there's nowhere we could go to escape an explosion of that magnitude.
But Miss...
We can't change the stakes. All we can do is formulate a plan to deal with our current reality.
You're right, but we can't do anything from here.
I'll go back inside the anomaly.
I cannot allow that, my champion. Your wellbeing is my responsibility. And after nearly losing you in the blast—
I'm not asking for permission. Someone needs to stop that crystal from blowing up, and I'm not going to sit on my hands.
You're right of course. Something must be done.
Very well. Then make me a promise—promise me that no matter what happens, you will return to my side safe and sound.
Leave it to me.
Please be careful.
We can't change the stakes. All we can do is formulate a plan to deal with our current reality.
You're right, but we can't do anything from here.
I'll go back inside the anomaly.
I cannot allow that, my champion. Your wellbeing is my responsibility. And after nearly losing you in the blast—
I'm not asking for permission. Someone needs to stop that crystal from blowing up, and I'm not going to sit on my hands.
Besides, I have to save my master. I know it won't be easy, but the alternative is the end of the world.
So I'm going in there, one way or another.
You're right of course. Something must be done.
Very well. Then make me a promise—promise me that no matter what happens, you will return to my side safe and sound.
Leave it to me.
Please be careful.
Please be careful.
It's you!
I suspected we would meet again.
What happened? The last time I saw you, you and Turka got sucked into some scary red portal.
Now is not the time to discuss that. There are greater things at stake.
I presume you've come here at the realization that the missing Runeblades hold the answer to our current predicament.
More or less.
No doubt you've also realized that $npcName:11004027[gender:0]$ is responsible for that business with the blackshard in El Nath. He and I have a score to settle.

The issue of preventing the explosion of the new dark crystal dwarfs all other concerns. In this respect, I believe your interests align with my own.

Rune magic. I was a Runeblade myself.

Is that really what you wish to discuss right now? Perhaps we should instead focus on the impending cataclysm.
I've been tracking the lapenshards by way of runic magic. A few days ago, I determined that the corrupted lapenshards that were scattered by the explosion were gathering once more here.
When I arrived to investigate, I discovered another kind of energy radiating from four dimensional pockets within this place.

It seems the power of the dark crystal has warped its surroundings, causing multiple spaces to overlap. Reaching the resultant pocket dimensions through traditional means would be impossible, however...
Given sufficient power, the rune embedded in each Runeblade's weapon is capable of cutting not just matter, but space itself. They can create a rift to travel between overlapping planes.
Are you saying you can cut us an entrance for these pocket dimensions?
Indeed, however...
However?
There's no guarantees I can prevent the rift from sealing itself.
Which is to say, were I to create such a rift, I would need to remain here to maintain it.
So you want me to go in by myself.
I do.
Unless of course you can fashion a rift yourself, in which case I would be happy to venture inside and locate the missing Runeblades.

Now, I will open a rift to the nearest of the four realms. When you return, I expect you report everything you witnessed and spare no detail.

I see. From what you've told me, it seems $npcName:11004041[gender:0]$ has not yet completely abandoned reason. We still have time to restore them to normal.

While you were off confronting $npcName:11004041[gender:0]$, I came here for medical treatment and did some thinking about how we might restore everyone to the way they were before. I had some ideas, but none I'm sure of.
Luckily, there was someone in this place of yours that actually understands lapenshards. I believe they can help us.
Luckily, there was someone in this place of yours that actually understands lapenshards. I believe they can help us.
When this guy showed up and started asking me a zillion questions, I figured you and he were connected.
It was quite annoying. Well, since I've already agreed to help, I'll just bill the Foundation for the overtime.
Now, while you were away we learned some things about the new dark crystal.
Your friend here told me that each of the three leaders of Terrun Calibre ended up in their own pocket dimension.
When I learned the region within the crater comprised a multidimensional space, I became quite interested.

From what I've been told of the geometry of the three realms occupied by the Runeblades, it sounded as though they were forming something of a barrier over a central space. And in that center we'll find—
The heads of Terrun Calibre. That must be where they retreated after we fought.
It seems highly probable. And based on the relative positions of the other spaces, we can deduce the spatial coordinates of the core. But that wasn't the only thing we learned.

Shortly after your biosignal weakened—which corresponded with your entering the rift our friend created—the dark crystal stopped accumulating energy and actually started consuming the energy it had already gathered.
That was when you were fighting with the Runeblades within the anomaly. That's how I knew my hypothesis was correct.
You see the Runeblades were drawing energy from the dark crystal from within the anomaly.

In short, I believe the runic mana within their bodies interacted in such a way with the energy of the original explosion that the scattered blackshards were drawn back in and accreted into the giant blackshard you see now.
The Runeblades formed their own dimensional pockets within the anomaly by reshaping the energy of the dark crystal, according to an innate desire.

As they draw more and more energy through the dark crystal, their bodies will reach their limits. As a result, their physical forms will disintegrate, along with the spaces they've created. When this happens, all of the energy accumulated within the anomaly will be released in one great explosion.
Pretty neat, huh?
Somehow apocalyptics destruction doesn't sound all that neat to me.
I was just joking! Lighten up a little.
I know what will happen when something with that much energy goes boom, and I'm not looking forward to it. There's still too much I haven't seen and done in this world. I can't let it come to that.
The remedy to our predicament is actually quite simple.
What's that?
If you can remove the Runeblades from the anomaly, the dark crystal will stop gathering power.
If you force the Runeblades to burn up energy, the power stored within the giant crystal will slowly be depleted.
Do you think you can do all that?
It sounds like there's no other choice.

Ahem. Fellow members of the Frontier Foundation.
We began our journey here with a mission to research and regulate a powerful new phenomenon of our world known as the lapenshards.

Though we were waylaid from that mission by numerous threats to the world—such as the weather anomalies in El Nath and the high seas, the discovery of Madrakan, and the disappearance of our friends after the dark crystal's explosion...
Never did we buckle under the pressure. In the end, we saved the world from utter devastation, and rescued our friends.
None of this would have been possible without the help of everyone here.
I, Beatrice di Alemani, first of my name, director the Frontier Foundation, am pleased to declare the threat of the blackshards ended.
Henceforth, the Frontier Foundation will redirect its efforts once more toward the research, acquisition, and regulation of the lapenshards, for the good of the world.
I want to extend my sincere gratitude to each of you for your part in our work thus far.
This concludes our investigation into the lapenshard anomalies.
This concludes our investigation into the lapenshard anomalies.
It's $MyPCName$, right? Working with you was actually pretty fun, I'm surprised to say. As for what comes next, I plan to remain here and continue my research on the lapenshards.
After all, there's nowhere more rich in the stuff than here!
I'd like to devise a means of teleporting using the power of the lapenshards in place of mana, for our mutual friend who hasn't quite managed to master the art.

<font color="#909090">(She glances around and then leans in to whisper.)</font> <font size='20'>And this is top-secret, but we actually have a sample blackshard here. Who knows what kind of amazing spells I'll develop by studying it?</font>
What?! I thought the blackshards were all gone?
Hahaha. Do you really place such faith in the silver tongue of nobility? You're a naïve one, aren't you?
And just what are you two mumbling about over there?
Ahh! Nothing! Anyway, I was just leaving. Out of my way, gramps. See you later, $MyPCName$!
Ahem. In any case, I would like to extend my deepest gratitude on behalf of the lady Beatrice.
Don't mention it...
Should you ever require the assistance of the Frontier Foundation, please do not hesitate to call. Until next we meet, take care of yourself.
$MyPCName$, I am in your debt. It seems the world is not quite ready to coexist alongside the lapenshards.
For now the others and I will return to $map:52000169$ to prepare for what's to come.
Your heroism has moved us—and shown us that we still have training to do.
Thank you for everything.
I guess you're not such a rookie after all. Thanks for what you did for us.
Thank you very much for saving us. It's reassuring to know that even in our absence, there are those who would defend this world.
Thanks for everything. Tinchai and I will return to Halo Mountain to work on restoring Guidance to its former glory.
$MyPCName$! Wherever you go next, I'll be cheering you on!
I have work to get back to with the Green Hoods myself. Take care of yourself.
I too have strayed too long from the Empress's side. I will return to Tria and carry out my duty.
Impressive work out there. We'll be watching you.
$MyPCName$, my other half!
Even if your mission has ended, you and I have made a pact.
I hope you'll come and visit me often. I'll be waiting.
Whenever you need me just call and I'll find my way back here.
<font size='40'>Then it's a promise!</font>
It's $MyPCName$, right? Working with you was actually pretty fun, I'm surprised to say. As for what comes next, I plan to remain here and continue my research on the lapenshards.
After all, there's nowhere more rich in the stuff than here!
I'd like to devise a means of teleporting using the power of the lapenshards in place of mana, for our mutual friend who hasn't quite managed to master the art.

<font color="#909090">(She glances around and then leans in to whisper.)</font> <font size='20'>And this is top-secret, but we actually have a sample blackshard here. Who knows what kind of amazing spells I'll develop by studying it?</font>
What?! I thought the blackshards were all gone?
Hahaha. Do you really place such faith in the silver tongue of nobility? You're a naïve one, aren't you?
And just what are you two mumbling about over there?
Ahh! Nothing! Anyway, I was just leaving. Out of my way, gramps. See you later, $MyPCName$!
Ahem. In any case, I would like to extend my deepest gratitude on behalf of the lady Beatrice.
Don't mention it...
Should you ever require the assistance of the Frontier Foundation, please do not hesitate to call. Until next we meet, take care of yourself.
$MyPCName$, I am in your debt. It seems the world is not quite ready to coexist alongside the lapenshards.
For now the others and I will return to $map:52000169$ to prepare for what's to come.
You've come a long way, $MyPCName$. I'm extremely proud of all you've accomplished, and how you've grown.
Thank you for all you've done on our behalf.
I guess you're not such a rookie after all. Thanks for what you did for us.
Thank you very much for saving us. It's reassuring to know that even in our absence, there are those who would defend this world.
Thanks for everything. Tinchai and I will return to Halo Mountain to work on restoring Guidance to its former glory.
$MyPCName$! Wherever you go next, I'll be cheering you on!
I have work to get back to with the Green Hoods myself. Take care of yourself.
I too have strayed too long from the Empress's side. I will return to Tria and carry out my duty.
Impressive work out there. We'll be watching you.
$MyPCName$, my other half!
Even if your mission has ended, you and I have made a pact.
I hope you'll come and visit me often. I'll be waiting.
Whenever you need me just call and I'll find my way back here.
<font size='40'>Then it's a promise!</font>
$MyPCName$, your presence is required at $map:52020037$ immediately.
I'm on my way.
Good. I cannot overstate the urgency of this matter. I hope to lay eyes on you soon.
<font color="#909090">($npcName:11004390[gender:1]$ seemed worried...)</font>
<font color="#909090">(You should hurry to $map:52020037$.)</font>
Thank you for joining us, $MyPCName$. We have gathered to discuss an unusual and urgent matter, the appearance of an unidentified continent in the skies of Maple World.
$npcName:11003536[gender:0]$, please bring everyone up to speed.

Right! The object first appeared on Sky Fortress's active radar at 9:12 AM Tria time. After entering Maple World's atmosphere, it descended into the troposphere where it appears to be holding altitude.
So far there's been no signs of activity on the floating continent. If anyone lives there, their motives are a mystery. However...
However?
Sky Fortress's equipment has detected the presence of lapenshards on the continent.
Is such a thing possible?! I presumed the lapenshards were unique to Maple World. How did they appear on a continent of unknown provenance?
By all accounts, the dark crystal's recent energy pulse was so powerful it pierced through the very heavens—a blast which immediately preceded the appearance of the floating continent.
Are you saying that it was the dark crystal explosion that brought the continent here?
More likely that than a coincidence. After all, the crystal was notably composed of lapenshards.

Your highness, I advise sending an investigatory expedition to the unidentified continent immediately. So far, they have shown no visible signs of hostility, but Maple World must be prepared to mount a defense.

...Very well. We do not yet know whether this new continent will prove a threat or a boon to Maple World. Furthermore, if it was affected by the dark crystal, then it is our responsibility to address the fallout.
$MyPCName$, will you help lead the investigation? Your experience would be of great aid.
Count me in.
Captain $npcName:11003533[gender:0]$.
$npcName:11003537[gender:0]$.
$npcName:11003536[gender:0]$.

I hereby order the Sky Fortress and its crew to depart for the unknown continent. While I leave the particulars of the operation to you, I ask that you establish a base of operations to serve as an alliance foothold there.
Thank you all for volunteering for this mission. Though the journey may prove dangerous, I will pray for your safe return.
<font color="#909090">(Your radio crackles and chimes.)</font> Sky Fortress to $MyPCName$, come in $MyPCName$. Requesting status update, over.
My pod had a bit of a rocky landing, but I'm in one piece.
Have you identified the source of the attack?
Don't be ridiculous, $male:he,female:she$ only just landed! More importantly, are you okay pumpkin? What's the situation on the ground?

If it were me, I would have simply connected the dropship to the Sky Fortress computer and compared the projectile's trajectory against topological data gleaned by the craft's sensors during its descent.
$MyPCName$, don't listen to him. All that matters is you landed safely. Still, our number one priority is figuring out who attacked us and why.
We have to figure out what we're up against, for the safety of Maple World.
$MyPCName$, I'm detecting a heat signature consistent with a humanoid lifeform 11 meters from your position. Assuming they're friendly, maybe they can shed some light on the situation?
We've identified an ideal site to establish a base. Sky Fortress should be arriving in about two hours. Once construction is complete, we will begin scouting the surrounding area.
I'm sending you the coordinates of our landing site. Proceed there once you have completed your mission.
What the heck are you wearing?
Is that really what's in fashion in Tairen these days? I guess a lot can change in seven years.
Tairen?
Wait, you're not an exile? Then where're you from? Scratch that. I don't really care, so long as you can be of use.
The aircraft I came here on was targeted by some kind of missile. Do you know who attacked us?

You must be talking about those guys who set up shop here a few days ago. Been tearing through Kidel on a mission to find something. You can tell just by looking they're not from around here. I can tell you what I know, but there's something I need from you first.
How can I help?
Sometimes even combat vets like me find themselves in a bit of a snafu. In my case, my gun's gone dry. Totally out of aetherine. Meanwhile I'm surrounded by a forest full of man-eating beasts.

I can't say I blame the critters. We did set up camp on their land. But seeing as I want to make it back to $map:02020030$ in one piece, I could use an assist. See those bugs there? They've got some grade-A aetherine growing right out of their spines.
You harvest some for me, and I can use it to charge up my rifle. After that, the trek back to $map:02020030$ will be a cakewalk. I may have left the service, but I'm still a sharpshooter.
That was some fine work there, $male:son,female:miss$. Clean, efficient kills. I was fairly certain those $npcNamePlural:25020003$ would be gnawing on your eyeballs right about now.
There's more than enough aetherine here to get my rifle charged up. I should be able to make it to $map:02020030$ without a hitch, thanks to you. Well a deal's a deal. What was it you wanted to know?
I want to know about the missiles that were fired on my ship. Who tried to shoot us down?

These strangers came to Kidel not long ago. Like you, they're outlanders. Word is they've built themselves a sizable base northeast of here. I don't know what they're after, but they've become quite the menace.
Whatever it is they're after, they're willing to kill for it. Nobody who's had the misfortune of running into them ever seems to come back alive. They have a camp on the hill north of here.
As for your missile, I did see one fire off from somewhere northwest of here. Good odds that's who tried to blow you out of the sky.
Then it looks like I know where I'm headed. Thanks for the information.
I wouldn't go that way if you're not looking to die. The road there is filled with mechanical soldiers who are none too friendly.
Woodland critters are one thing—bloodthirsty or otherwise—but those machines will cut you in two without a moment's hesitation.
I appreciate the concern, but I'm not afraid of a bunch of robots. I've got a mission to complete.
Well, if you really want to die, that's your prerogative. I'm not going to stand in your way. Good luck, stranger.
Before I go, can you tell me any more about those mechanical soldiers?
You know as much as I do. If I wanted to know more I'd have to go up to them, and I'm not quite dumb enough for that.
Oh, and one more thing. That missile of yours was destroyed by something here on land. I don't know what exactly shot it down, but it made quite the explosion.
Are you the one who took out all these soldiers?
Do you know what destroyed the missile they fired at our ship?
...Soldiers? Missile? I don't understand. What is this place? Ungh. I'm so hungry... I feel like I'm going to faint.
Stay here, I'll find you something to eat.
I don't want to be here alone. Please hurry back.
Is that fruit? It looks good! Thanks.
<font color="#909090">(You pick up your radio and push the talk button).</font> $MyPCName$ to Sky Fortress. I have an update on the operation. Please respond.
<font color="#909090">(There is a brief silence, then your radio crackles to life.)</font> Sky Fortress here. I trust you have by now identified our mysterious assailants?
We were attacked by Dark Army soldiers. They appear to have set up a number of surface-to-air missile launchers in advance of our arrival.
Dark Army soldiers?! What are they doing here?
The better question is how they knew we were coming. If they went as far as setting up anti-aircraft weaponry, they must have been intent on keeping us out.
$MyPCName$, thank you for delivering this new information.
I have a new assignment for you. I want you to determine why the Dark Army has come to this land. That will be all for now. Over and out.
D-don't come any closer! I'll blow your head clean off! This gun is fully charged!
Calm down.
Calm down!? You do what you did, and then you tell me to calm down? You are one of them, aren't you?
The ones who captured my brothers-in-arms were outlanders just like you. Get out of my sight! Any funny business and I'll take you out!
Have it your way. <font color="#909090">(You turn and begin to walk away.)</font>
Hey, w-where do you think you're going?!
You just said... Make up your mind!
I'm sorry... It's hard to know who to trust. Those outlanders took my friends. The three of us barely made it out alive.
What happened?
Hostiles in dark cloaks. Their little inquisition has been terrorizing the area. We came across their ship's landing site out on patrol, and they ambushed our squad.
We made it out, but the rest of our squad was taken captive. I brought these two here to recover and pursued the aggressors on foot. But after what I witnessed, I turned tail and ran.
They had corralled my squad into this clearing, and then they just... sat there. They were waiting for something.
What happened?
It was like... some kind of demon...
It was terrible...

...And then I ran for my life. Listen, my friends are in no shape to move and they're in need of immediate medical attention. I could do something about their injuries if I had some of the medicinal herbs that grow in aetherine-infused soil.
Please, will you gather the herbs for me? I don't want to leave their side.
<font color="#909090">(Your radio crackles.)</font> Sky Fortress to $MyPCName$. Requesting progress update.
<font color="#909090">(You relay everything $npcName:11004393$ told you.)</font>

A cloaked figure with large horns...? He must have meant $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$. And he said $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ was looking for a specific woman? Did the Dark Army really come here just to find a single person?!
Huh. I guess even hideous, murderous wraiths get lonely.
This is no time for jokes! We've got to identify this woman and find out why the forces of darkness are after her.
Hmm. I wonder if this could be related to the woman you encountered earlier? $MyPCName$, see what you can find out about this person the Dark Army is after, and whatever it is they are plotting.
I'm on it. After I help $npcName:11004393$ tend to his wounded friends, I'll resume my investigation. $MyPCName$ out.
Please hurry. The plant has a very distinctive appearance. It should be easy to pick it out from the forest's foliage.
Thank you for this. With these herbs I should be able to get them well enough to travel to a proper medical facility.
I'm sorry I misjudged you. I suppose not all of you outlanders are the same. Is there any way I can thank you for what you've done?
This woman the Dark Army is after—do you know anything about her?
Sorry... I'm just a pathfinder. That sort of intel is above my pay grade.
Hmm. Well, maybe you can tell me this: if your organization came across a wounded "exile," where would they take them?
Now that I can answer. Our base of operations is a little town called $map:02020030$. I'm surprised you didn't know that.
I don't really know anything about this land.

So you're not just an outlander... You're not even from Kritias! And yet you still helped us... Well, I suppose I can fill you in on some of the details. I'm a member of Humanitas. We're a group of freedom fighters formed to oppose the tyranny of Tairen.
What can you tell me about Tairen?
Tairen is the greatest society in all of Kritias. It's where I was born, and the homeland of every member of Humanitas. And now they consider us enemies of the state...
Why is it that you're at odds with this Tairen?

The kingdom is under the control of an artificial lifeform called $npcName:11004432$ whose vision of utopia carries an unacceptable cost. We fled Tairen to be free of her control and built a new home here in the wilderness—$map:02020030$.
$npcName:11004432$ sent her mechanical soldiers to destroy $map:02020030$, but together we persevered. Despite her attacks, we've managed to survive out here for more than seven years.
Now I need to see to my comrades. If I were you I'd make my way to $map:02020030$. Between my superiors and the townspeople, someone should have the answers you're looking for. Good luck, outlander.
There's a bridge northwest of our position that will take you straight to $map:02020030$. You can't miss it.
You must be the outlander our soldiers encountered at the missile site.
Our intelligence network is nothing if not impressive. Plus, you can't expect soldiers not to chat about encountering someone from a distant land.
So, what business does an outlander have in $map:02020030$?
I'm here investigating what the Dark Army is doing in your land.

Hmm? You must mean the Daemon Army. Those cloaked monsters have been steadily encroaching on our territory, and now they're close enough to threaten $map:02020030$. Of course from our perspective, you're just as much a threat as they are.

If you want to take them on, have at it. We won't stop you. But if you harm our people, we will loose the full power of our forces and obliterate you. If we weren't dealing with the constant threat of siege by those blasted mechanical soldiers, there's no way we'd let you outlanders run wild in our territory.

You may not realize this, but your continent recently appeared in the skies of our world out of nowhere. The Maple Alliance isn't here to meddle in your affairs, we're here to determine whether you're a threat to us.
Maple Alliance...? Is that what you call your faction? And the ones who've been attacking our troops are the "Dark Army?" Hmph. Our name for them is catchier.
I don't know what the Dark, err... "Daemon Army" has planned for your land, but if left alone they're a threat to both your people and mine.

Your story seems reasonable enough, and the soldiers you encountered spoke well of you... $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$, our leader, has an office just up those steps. I can arrange a meeting for you, if you're interested.
That would be fantastic.
However—just because your story sounds reasonable doesn't mean it's true. How am I to know you're not a spy or an assassin sent by the Daemon Army?

The Daemon soldiers attacking our town represent a clear and present danger. Getting some of their blood on your hands would go a long way toward building good will with $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$. In any case, I'll let her know to expect you.
If you want to gain $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$'s trust, you can start by dealing with some of the Dark Army soldiers on our doorstep.
I wondered when you'd make your way here. Our scouts have kept me apprised of your activities in our land.
Including your little brawl with the Daemon Army. So tell me, what brings an outlander into our territory?

My name is $MyPCName$. I represent a coalition known as the Maple Alliance which is responsible for the defense of my world. A few days ago your continent appeared in our skies, so we arranged an expedition to figure out what you're doing here.

I assure you it wasn't our intent to appear in your skies. Kritias was sealed away by an unknown power a very long time ago. To us it felt like total darkness—a dreamless sleep that never ended. I don't know how long we spent in that state.

And then the seal was suddenly released, and we found ourselves here in the skies of your world. Those you call the Dark Army landed soon after. They have been rampaging throughout the Kidel region, and now they threaten us here in $map:02020030$.
It takes all of our strength to keep the mechanical soldiers of Tairen at bay, and yet now we find ourselves waging a war on two fronts—thanks to the Daemon Army.
The "Daemon Army" is looking for someone here in Kritias. Maybe even your friend there. We don't know why, but whatever their reason it can't be good. They are a serious threat to Kritias.

Perhaps. But you don't really care about that, do you? You care that they're a threat to you. Our data analysts have accessed your historical archives. We know that your Alliance and the Daemon Army are at war.
But why have you brought that battle to our domain? We refuse to be a proxy to your war! Tell the captain of your vessel they have ten days to withdraw or they will be fired upon!
$npc:11004395$, please stop shouting! This $male:man,female:woman$ is a good person. $male:He,female:She$ brought me food when I was hungry.
I was not shouting, I was merely making myself perfectly clear!
I met this woman in the forest in the middle of a destroyed Daemon Army camp. What is she doing in your office?
This conversation is ended! If you require it, my adjutant $npcName:11004396[gender:0]$ will arrange your transportation back to your vessel.
I expect the way back to your ship will be perilous, thanks to the Daemon soldiers scattered throughout the region...
Good day. I'm Adjutant $npcName:11004396[gender:0]$.
My little brother $npcName:11004393[gender:0]$ says that two of his squadmates are alive and on the road to recovery, thanks to your actions. For that you have my thanks.

I'm given to understand you had a meeting with $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$. I'd wager from the look on your face it didn't go very well. I apologize if she said anything untoward. She's got a lot on her plate. Tairen has stepped up their attacks as of late, and now we're under siege by the Daemon Army.
Your brother told me a little about your conflict with the Tairen, but I didn't get the whole story. Why is it they keep attacking you?

It's because we revolted against the artificial lifeform who controls the entirety of Tairen, $npcName:11004432$. We formed Humanitas in order to take it back from her. Personally, I take it as a compliment she thinks we're enough of a threat to warrant killing.
Our numbers may be small, but we're confident the citizens of Tairen will join us as they come to see our cause is true.
I get all that, but why did you revolt, and why didn't the rest of the kingdom join you?

To answer your second question, many of the kingdom's denizens believe it has become a utopia under $npcName:11004432$'s reign. $npcName:11004432$ takes care of everything, from manufacturing and construction to agriculture, governance, and even population control. She analyzes everything to determine an "optimal" outcome, and acts.
The people of Tairen live lives of abundance, free from worry. You see, $npcName:11004432$ was created to optimize our society, and initially, it seemed she was an amazing success...
So then what was the problem? How did all this lead to a revolt?

Well you see, $npcName:11004432$ decided that truly optimizing society required people to give up their free will. Her "utopia" required precision and predictability, two traits people generally lack. So she decided anyone who didn't fit her mold or who broke the rules would be exiled. We decided we wouldn't stand for that.

<font color="#909090">(A device on the Adjutant's armor gives off a series of electronic purrs, and then a voice issues forth.)</font> Southwatch to $map:02020030$, do you read? Our position is being overrun. Requesting immediate backup!

Southwatch, this is $map:02020030$. Alpha Squad is out on patrol, and taking any soldiers off the wall would compromise our primary defenses. Reinforcements from $map:02020033$ are at least two hours out. How long can you hold out?
We've got wounded here, $map:02020030$. I'd say one hour, at the very most.
Let me go. I can help them.
You'd do that? For us? You have my profound gratitude. Southwatch is our first line of defense against the Daemon Army. We can't afford to lose it.
Because of you Southwatch is still standing, and most of my men are alive. I don't know how to thank you, outlander.
Southwatch is $map:02020030$'s southernmost lookout. From here we can observe the enemy's approach, and crush them with a two-pronged attack.
Losing this post would be a crippling blow and would endanger $map:02020030$'s survival.
I'm glad I could be of help. If there's nothing else, I'll be returning to $map:02020030$.

There is one more thing we could use your help with. One of our soldiers got cut off from our position during the fighting. If he's alive, please escort him to $map:02020030$ to receive medical attention.
But... should the worst have transpired, I'd like you to retrieve the identification tag from around his neck and deliver it to $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$.
To $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$? Were the two close?
That's not my story to tell. Anyways, thanks again. Be careful out there.
Keep your eyes peeled for a Daemon Army ambush.
I believe I instructed you in no uncertain terms to return to your ship. What are you doing back here?!
I retrieved this from the body of a soldier. I was asked to bring it to you.
...This young man was the first exile I rescued after I founded Humanitas. Did he suffer?
I'm afraid I can't say. He was already dead when I found him.
I see. Well, thank you for bringing this to me. My adjutant says you risked your own life to assist our soldiers at the southern watch post. I would like to know why.
Because it was the right thing to do.
Which I'm guessing is the same reason you're looking after that exile. I know you're skeptical, but our two peoples have more in common than you think.
Yes, there are things we have in common. More than you could have imagined. For instance, this exile is the child of $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$—a man your people revere as a sage.
What? How could you know that?

Because I was $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$'s lover. I am one of the Hallowed—the noble houses of Kritias. We possess the unique talent of sensing one's bloodline through the aetherine flowing in their veins. $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$ and she are kin.
But the sages lived hundreds of years ago!
Kritias was sealed away for what might have been centuries. What for you is ancient history, was for us a matter of years.

Not long after $npcName:11004432$ began exiling those she deemed useless to society, I founded Humanitas. But $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$... He took a different path. He refused to stand by and watch the people of Tairen turn their weapons against each other. So he left our world, and found his way to yours.

$npcName:11004431[gender:0]$ was the greatest magician in the Royal Office of Arcana. If he had only joined Humanitas, we would be on much more even footing in our struggle against Tairen. To your ancestors, his power must have seemed godlike. It's no wonder they considered him a sage.
I did once read that the sage $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$ had a daughter named $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$... But that's the only thing anyone ever wrote about her.

$npcName:11004400[gender:1]$?! Are you sure? After we awakened from the long darkness, our analysts hacked into the Royal Office of Arcana's archives to understand what had happened. We found communications speculating that an entity called $npcName:11004432$ was responsible for sealing Kritias away.
Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine that "$npcName:11004400[gender:1]$" was a person, let alone the woman standing in my office!
What was she thinking?!
If the Daemon Army gets their hands on the power $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ used to seal Kritias, neither of our peoples will be safe.
I can't allow that to happen.

And I can't allow that horned brute to harm $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$'s child. Thankfully, I had the foresight to order a tracker placed on $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ when she arrived in our care—in case she, like her father, decided to stray.

<font color="#909090">(She fiddles with a strange device for a few moments, then scowls.)</font> I can't get a signal. Our signal repeater must've been damaged by the Daemon Army. Getting the parts necessary to replace it will take far too long! Unless...
We might be able to repair the repeater, but we'll need parts from the Tairens' mechanical soldiers.
I'm good at breaking things, just point me at them.
Excellent. Inside the MK-II's control module, you'll find a spherical, pronged device. That's what we're after. You'll need to pry it gently from its socket and bring it to $npc:11004386$.
<font color="#909090">(You pick up your radio and push the talk button).</font> $MyPCName$ to Sky Fortress. Come in Sky Fortress.
<font color="#909090">(Your radio crackles.)</font> This is Sky Fortress. Have you identified the woman $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ is searching for, or what his aims are?
<font color="#909090">(You fill the crew in on everything you've learned.)</font>

You're telling me $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ has captured the person responsible for sealing Kritias?! That sort of power in the hands of the forces of darkness represents an existential threat to the Maple Alliance. We must initiate a rescue plan at once!
Before $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ was captured, $npcName:11004395$'s people placed a tracker on her. We just need to repair the signal repeater. With any luck, we should be able to find her.
Begin at once. We will provide any support necessary.
I suggest positioning Sky Fortress over $map:02020030$. Wherever they've taken her, we should be ready to mobilize as soon as we determine $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$'s location.
This takes precedence over our current endeavor. We should depart at once!
Nairin?
According to our on-board AI, Cat Sith, factoring in the time it will take to unload our cargo, get the crew back aboard, and begin launch preparations...
We should be ready to depart in approximately one hour and 17 minutes, give or take a minute.

$MyPCName$, we will set a course for $map:02020030$ as soon as we're able. Until then, you are to do everything in your power to locate and rescue $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$. Everything hangs in the balance. Sky Fortress out.
Ready to go get that part? Tairen's mechanized soldiers won't go down without a fight. Be careful.
$npcName:11004395[gender:1]$ brought me up to speed on your plan. Did you get the part we need to repair the repeater?
I pulled this out of the guts of one of those mechanical soldiers. This is the thingy you needed, right?
An ESR-193 shortwave amplifier... That's the part! Thank you. As soon as one of our squads is back from patrol, I'll task them with repairing the signal repeater.
We don't have the time to wait around for that. Can't you just talk me through the repair?
If you're offering to handle the repair, that would be great. I'm not familiar with the specifics of the device, but I have a technical manual here you can borrow.

Before you go, I was wondering about something. $npcName:11004387$ said you told him the Daemon Army tried to blow your ship out of the sky when you first arrived, but that the missile exploded on its own.
It wasn't intercepted by our people, which begs the question—who destroyed it? The odds it was a malfunction are incredibly low. I worry there may be yet another faction at play.
Sorry, you're asking the wrong $male:guy,female:girl$.
I'd better get to repairing the repeater. The clock's ticking.
The tracking device we slipped onto $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ is useless until we repair the signal repeater. That area's crawling with Daemon soldiers, so watch yourself.
$MyPCName$, you've returned. I take it the repeater is back online? Let's see...

<font color="#909090">(She powers on her device and presses some buttons.)</font> I've got a fix on her signal! It's coming from... $map:02020031$?! That's the site of one of Tairen's ore extractors...
What possible reason could they have for taking $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ there? I don't understand... Could it be that the Daemon Army and Tairen are working together?
I'll travel to $map:02020031$ and rescue $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$.
Good. $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ is at the heart of many questions I'd like to see answered—such as how she lost her memory. In any case, we have agents in $map:02020031$ who can assist you.
They were deployed to track Tairen's resource shipments, so there's a good chance they saw the Daemon Army passing through. I'll draft a new order to assist you by any means necessary.

$MyPCName$, I'm placing my trust in you... Don't make me regret it. If you cannot rescue $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ on your own, report back with any tactical information you can glean. I'll order our forces at $map:02020033$ to prepare for an imminent operation.
Locate our agents in $map:02020031$. They must have seen something. The safety of both our peoples is in your hands.
Hold it, stranger! Don't take another step! What've you got in your hands there?

<font color="#909090">(He snatches $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$'s orders from you and looks them over.)</font> These came straight from $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$! She says I'm to assist you in any way possible.
I'm tracking a woman named $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ who was captured by the Daemon Army. I have reason to believe they brought her here to $map:02020031$.
Yes, the Daemon Army came through here, and I did see a woman with them. There was also a horned... thing. It took over $map:02020031$ in the blink of an eye. Literally!
That must be $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$. What do you mean he "took over $map:02020031$"? Just how large are his forces?!

I don't know how big they were before, but they're bigger now! That horned thing floated straight up to Tairen's mechanized soldiers, and then these beams of blue light shot out from under his hood, where his eyes ought to be. And just like that, every Tairen soldier in sight fell under his control.
But that's not all. The soldiers... their appearance changed too. They turned dark... I don't know if that horned thing was using magic or advanced technology, but I've never seen anything like it!
Where did they take $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$?
They took her inside the old fusion reactor to the northeast, but... You're not going to have an easy time getting past all those metal soldiers.
I'm sure I'll figure something out.
We have another agent stationed inside the fusion reactor. I'll radio ahead to let him know you're coming. Good luck.
How did this $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ guy take control of all those Tairen soldiers?
You're the $male:guy,female:girl$? I've been waiting.
$npcName:11004398[gender:0]$ brought me up to speed on that woman you're looking for.
Did you see where $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ took her?

They barreled through here and into the reactor. Then all of the sudden, the whole facility went on lockdown. The blast doors all slammed shut. And good luck getting through those things. We're talking three layers of Zybithium-composite meant to contain the force of an exploding fusion reactor.
Near as I can tell, there's not a single problem with the reactor though. These guys must have triggered the lockdown manually.
They're trying to make sure no one gets in...
Stand back, I'll try and open the door.

It's useless. I already tried the manual override. Even hooked up a hacking tool and tried to pop it digitally, but I couldn't get a response. I think they destroyed the microcomputer in charge of raising and lowering the door.

The only way you're getting that door open is to blow it up, or the aetherine spire on top of the facility... According to the reactor's emergency manual, the blast doors are all hooked up to a manual release that triggers when the plant's aetherine supply is cut off.
Problem is, there isn't a weapon in our arsenal that'll blow that door, and the spire's built from pretty much the same stuff.
Sorry, but I don't see that door opening until the people inside want it to.
I'll head back to $map:02020030$ and figure something out.
$MyPCName$, you're back. I don't see $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ with you...
What?! The reactor's on lockdown? Giving up on $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ is not an option. We'll just have to blast our way in!
Woah now, let's not get hasty!
Our aircraft are equipped with bunker-busting bombs that should certainly be able to pierce the facility's walls.
I'm no physicist, but sounds like the sort of thing that might cause the reactor to explode in a monumental ball of flame. I'm not a huge fan of the "everybody dies" scenario.
Well, we have landcruisers at $map:02020033$ equipped with aetherine railguns we could use to deliver a more precise blast to cut our way inside the facility.
I take it from the name those vehicles travel by land... I'm afraid they just wouldn't make it in time.
Well then what do you propose?! We cannot allow $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$'s power to fall into the hands of our enemies!
One of your agents said something about taking out the reactor's aetherine spire—I have an idea. Let me call my people. <font color="#909090">(You pick up your radio and signal Sky Fortress.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(Your radio crackles).</font> This is Sky Fortress. What is your status?

The Daemon, err, Dark Army is holding $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ inside the fusion reactor in $map:02020031$, but the place is locked down. Destroying the aetherine spire on top of the building will force open the blast doors so we can get in. But we need to be sure that's all we hit, or else... boom.

Landing a direct hit on the facility's spire without damaging the building's structure... It's feasible, but it's going to be a challenge. We'll need to fine-tune the particle accelerator and triple-check the math.
But first, we'll need to get there. We're about 27 minutes out from $map:02020031$.
We've lost too much time as it is. Who knows what they're doing to $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ as we speak? What if they've already found a way to harness her power? There's no time to lose.
Cat Sith calculates that firing from this distance would result in a 34.7% chance of missing the target. Do you really want to risk destroying the reactor and everything in and around it?
It's worth the risk, Captain. Besides, if anyone can pull off the shot, it's our crew. We can do this.
Captain, $MyPCName$'s argument is sound.
Just give the order, captain!
Very well. Nairin, deploy the Big Gun and fire up the Magitron reactor! We'll take the shot as soon as everything is ready. The rest is up to you, $MyPCName$. Veliche out.
That's a bold plan you've got, but I believe it could work. Good luck, $MyPCName$. Find $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ and bring her back safely.
I'll do my best.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. Please bring $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ back safely.
Are you CRAZY?! You could've blown this place sky high!
If you had hit even ten meters lower we'd all be dead!
But we didn't. Because our team is the best there is.
Hmph. Maybe. But your rescue mission isn't over yet.
Your friends in there are going to notice that all the doors have popped open. They're probably organizing you a welcome party as we speak.
I can handle the Daemon Army.
Well, I can't question the resolve of somebody who's willing to risk killing everybody to get what they want. Good lucky rescuing your lady friend.
$npcName:11004400[gender:1]$! Are you all right? I got here as soon as I could, but it looks like you've got it under control.
You came here for me...? Thanks.
I think I'm the one who should be thanking you. It was you who destroyed the missile they fired at Sky Fortress, wasn't it?
Yes, but I wouldn't read anything into it. I destroyed it on instinct. I had no idea who your people were until I regained my memory.
Maybe on a subconscious level you helped us because Maple World is your home.
No... My father was the one who loved your world and its people.
Why did you seal Kritias away?
That was a long time ago. Long before you were even born. You've heard of the artificial lifeform that rules Tairen, haven't you? $npcName:11004432$.
After $npcName:11004432$ took over the Tairen Kingdom, she transported the entire Kritias continent to Maple World. Her goal is to do to your world what she did to Tairen.
How could anyone consider a place where they exile everybody who doesn't fit the mold a "utopia?"

That's not how $npcName:11004432$ saw it. To her, she was just eliminating defects from a system. Optimizing it. It's the way she was programmed. According to her metrics, these people weren't contributing as much to Tairen as they took from it. It was a heartless diagnosis, and it disgusted my father. That's why he left for Maple World.
So when Kritias arrived in Maple World, you sealed it away to protect us? Even knowing that you would be trapped alongside it?
...Now that the seal is broken, $npcName:11004432$ will try to take over your world. Don't let her. Defend the land that my father loved.
You're not going to help us? With your power—

No, there's something I need to take care of before anything else. As for my power, I've yet to unlock it's true potential. Something is preventing me from harnessing the full power of the lapenta I absorbed.
Where will you go?
I'm going to fight in my own way.
Tell Marlene I'm grateful for everything.
The fate of your world is in your hands.
Defend it well.
...She didn't return with you?
The Dark Army—or Daemon Army as you call them—will never give up on capturing $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$. Using the power of the Blue Lapenta within her, they could conquer Maple World.
We'll never allow that to happen. Not while this ship still flies, and the Alliance stands.
If what $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ said is true—that Tairen intends on invading your world—then we share a common enemy. Why not pool our resources against them?

I'm afraid that for us, securing $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$ and keeping her out of the hands of the forces of darkness is a much greater priority. I shudder to think what they could achieve with the power of the Blue Lapenta.
We can't take $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$'s warning about a Tairen invasion lightly. She is $npcName:11004431[gender:0]$'s daughter and the person who sealed Kritias away to protect our world.
Our land is alien to you. If you intend to battle the Daemon Army on our soil, you would be wise to accept our aid.
Captain, why not put your trust in the woman who sacrificed her own future and the future of her father's homeland to protect our world?
$MyPCName$, you've spent more time on the ground than anyone else on the crew. What are your thoughts?

I believe in $npcName:11004400[gender:1]$. She can take care of herself. At least for now, I think Tairen is the threat we should be worrying about. Their technology is advanced and we know almost nothing about them. As for $npcName:11004401[gender:1]$ and her offer, I've found her to be an honorable and well-meaning leader... even if she's a bit rash and short-tempered.
What did you say?!
Another well-reasoned, albeit unnecessarily personal argument.
Well then. $npcName:11004401[gender:1]$, leader of Humanitas—in the interest of future cooperation and the good of our peoples, I extend the hand of friendship on behalf of the Maple Alliance.
While our Empress $npcName:11004390[gender:1]$ is the final authority in these matters, I have discretion in such trying times as these to formalize this partnership.
Yes! Together we'll fight against Tairen and the Daemon Army to protect both Maple World and Kritias from harm!
Yes... Together. What do you say, $MyPCName$?
Our two worlds share a common heritage, and we're much stronger together. You can count me in!
음…원래의 계획대로라면… 지금쯤 <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000001$ 왕실의 관계자</font>들과 만나고 있었을 터인데 일이 틀어지고 말았다.
혹시 급하게 만날 사람이 있다고 하신 것이 트라이아 왕실이었는지 물어본다.

그래. 테룬칼리브에 전해지던 구전에 따르면 머나먼 과거, <font color="#ffd200">옛 선조들이 후세를 위해 안배해놓은 지식</font>들이 빅토리아 아일랜드 어딘가에 있다고 하였다. 하지만 <font color="#ffd200">그림자 군단</font>이라 불리우는 어둠의 세력이 빅토리아 아일랜드를 뒤덮자… 선조들은 지식을 지키기 위해 <font color="#ffd200">룬의 장막</font>을 펼쳐 이목을 피하였다고 하지.
그 내용에 따르면 선조들이 남긴 지식들이 <font color="#ffd200">빅토리아 아일랜드 어딘가</font>에 고스란히 남겨져 있다는 것이다. 테룬칼리브에서는 이 지식을 가리켜 통칭 <font color="#ffd200">바즈의 지혜</font>라고 불렀지.
하지만 칼리브 아일랜드가 고향인 우리 룬 블레이더들로서는 빅토리아 아일랜드에 있는 바즈의 지혜를 찾는 것이 쉬운 일이 아니다. 게다가 악의 위협을 피하기 위해 선조들이 펼친 <font color="#ffd200">룬의 장막</font> 역시 바즈의 지혜가 있는 장소를 더욱 가늠하기 어렵게 만들고 있지.
그래서 조력자가 필요한 것인지 물어본다.

빅토리아 아일랜드를 지배하는 $npcTitle:11000075[gender:1]$라면 우리에게 큰 도움을 줄 수 있으리라 여겼다. 헌데 이곳에 와보니 <font color="#ffd200">$npcTitle:11000075[gender:1]$의 알현식</font>이 취소되고 소란스럽더구나. 덕분에 $npcTitle:11000075[gender:1]$$pp:는,은$ 고사하고 고위 관계자 한 명 만나기 어려웠다. 이렇게 된 바에야 우리 힘만으로 <font color="#ffd200">바즈의 지혜</font>를 찾으려 한다.
우리가 쫓는 것은 $npc:11001231[gender:0]$$pp:가,이$ 아니었는지 물어본다.
$MyPCName$, 네 말이 맞다. <font color="#ffd200">홀슈타트를 쫓기 위해</font> 바즈의 지혜를 찾으려는 것이다. 칼리브 아일랜드에서의 행보로 보아 그 녀석이 원하는 것은 바즈의 지혜로 추정된다. 바즈의 지혜 중에서도 <font color="#ffd200">궁극의 비기</font>가 담겨져 있다는 전설 상의 지식을 말이지.
그 말은…바즈의 지혜를 찾다보면 $npc:11001231[gender:0]$$pp:와,과$ 만날 수 있겠다고 말한다.
바로 보았구나. 그것이 이 스승의 계획이다. 그렇기 때문에 우리는 최대한 빨리 <font color="#ffd200">바즈의 지혜가 있을 장소</font>를 찾아야 한다. 이 낯선 땅에서 우리에게 필요한 것은 <font color="#ffd200">정보</font>다. 구전에 따르면 바즈의 지혜는 일종의 유적으로 볼 수 있다.

내가 알아본 바로는 $map:2000001$에 있는 <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000031$</font>은 겉 보기와 달리 오랜 역사를 자랑한다고 하더구나. <font color="#ffd200">$npc:11000005[gender:1]$</font>$pp:라,이라$는 여자도 꽤 유능한 사서라고 알려져 있으니 그곳에서라면 <font color="#ffd200">어떤 정보</font>든 찾을 수 있으리라는 생각이 든다.

내가 알아본 바로는 $map:2000001$에 있는 <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000031$</font>은 겉 보기와 달리 오랜 역사를 자랑한다고 하더구나. <font color="#ffd200">$npc:11000005[gender:1]$</font>$pp:라,이라$는 여자도 꽤 유능한 사서라고 알려져 있으니 그곳에서라면 <font color="#ffd200">어떤 정보</font>든 찾을 수 있으리라는 생각이 든다.
무슨 일로 찾아오셨죠?
바즈의 지혜라는 이름의 유적이 기록된 문서를 찾고 있다고 말한다.
바즈의 지혜? …희한하군요. 낮에도 그 이름을 물어보는 자가 있었는데…
그자의 인상착의에 대해 물어본다.
굉장히 차가워 보이는 인상의 남자였죠. 하늘빛의 찰랑거리는 머리와 특이한 가면을 착용하고 있었기 때문에 기억에 남아요.
음? 안색이 좋지 않아보이는데 무슨 일이라도 있나요?
별 일 아니라고 말한다.
어쨌거나 그때 그 남자가 물었을때는 $map:2000001$ 전체에 <font color="#ffd200">소란스러운 일</font>도 있었고… 저도 관련된 정보를 찾을 수가 없어 돌려보냈죠. 그런데 시간이 지나고 옛 사서 기록을 살펴보니 유사한 내용을 찾을 수가 있었어요.
지금 확인해볼 수 있겠느냐고 물어본다.
그건 어렵지 않아요. 다만 저는 가장 <font color="#ffd200">유사한 기록이 적힌 문헌</font>을 찾아드린 것 뿐… 이것이 당신이 찾는 그 <font color="#ffd200">바즈의 지혜</font>인지 아닌지는 저로서도 알 수 없어요. 그리고, 이게 가장 중요한 건데…
무슨 문제라도 있는지 물어본다.

오래된 <font color="#ffd200">고대의 문헌</font>이라 보존 상태가 좋지 않았어요. 기록된 글자들은 철자를 알아보기도 어렵고, 군데군데 <font color="#ffd200">썩어있는 부분</font>도 있구요. 한 마디로 이 문헌을 읽고 어떤 정보를 얻기란 지금 상태론 <font color="#ffd200">불가능</font>하다는 이야기죠.
무슨 방법이 없겠느냐고 물어본다.
이 도서관에 쌓여있는 문헌이 대체 얼마나 되리라고 생각해요? 보존해야할 문헌도 많고 해마다 훼손되는 문헌도 많아요. 그때마다 소중한 문헌을 소각할 수도 없는 일 아니겠어요?
이런 일에는 다 <font color="#ffd200">전문가</font>가 따로 있는 법이니 너무 걱정 말아요. <font color="#ffd200">$npc:11001261[gender:0]$</font>에게 맡기면 큰 문제는 없을 거예요.
어디로 가야 $npc:11001261[gender:0]$$pp:를,을$ 만날 수 있는지 물어본다.
그는 특별한 재료를 찾겠다고 자주 여행을 다녀서 정해진 장소가 딱히 없어요. 최근에는 <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000014$</font>에 위치한 <font color="#ffd200">$map:52000019$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 간다고 들었던 것 같은데… 그곳으로 가보면 만날 수 있지 않겠어요?
$npc:11001261[gender:0]$$pp:가,이$ 최근에 <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000014$</font>에 위치한 <font color="#ffd200">$map:52000019$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 갔다고 들었던 것 같아요. 그곳으로 가보면 만날 수 있지 않을까요?
쉿쉿! 조용히, 조용히! $npc:21000074$들이 깨어나지 않게 조심하라구!
이곳에서 대체 뭘 하고 있는지 물어본다.
특별한 재료를 채취하고 있는 중이네. 내가 하는 일이 오래된 문서나 낡은 장신구 같이 손질이 필요한 물건들을 <font color="#ffd200">새것처럼 복원하는 일</font>이라서 말이지. $npc:21000074$같은 유충의 <font color="#ffd200">분비물</font>을 내 작업의 중요한 재료로 사용하곤 하지.
듣기엔 꽤 위험한 작업일지도 모르겠다고 말한다.

티를 내지 않고 다들 쉬쉬하고 있는 것일 뿐입니다. 몇몇 사람들이 $map:02010005$에 <font color="#ffd200">험한 짓</font>을 하기도 했지만…다들 방관하고 있죠.
음…환자들을 직접 살펴보고 싶다고 말한다.
당신에게 무슨 <font color="#ffd200">뾰족한 수</font>라도 있다고는 생각되지 않지만… 환자를 만나는 것쯤이야 특별히 문제될 것은 없죠. $map:02010005$$pp:는,은$ 미나르 북쪽에 위치해 있습니다.
당신에게 무슨 <font color="#ffd200">뾰족한 수</font>라도 있다고는 생각되지 않지만… 환자를 만나는 것쯤이야 특별히 문제될 것은 없죠. $map:02010005$$pp:는,은$ 미나르 북쪽에 위치해 있습니다.
무…무슨 일로 오셨죠? 저희 이제 아프지 않아요! …그러니까 괴롭히지 말아요…
괴롭히러 온 것이 아니라고 말한다.
그…그럼…? 여긴 아무도 가까이 오려고 하지 않는 곳인데…
마을에 괴상한 질병이 돌고 있다는 이야길 듣고 찾아왔다고 말한다.
그랬군요… 전 또 우리를 괴롭히러 온 줄로만 알았어요…
마을 사람들은 이곳에 있는 모두를 싫어해요…
마을 사람들이 이곳을 엉망진창으로 만든 것이냐고 물어본다.
사람들이 이 움막에 있는 가구도 부수고 쓰레기를 던지고 마구 소리쳤어요… 우리더러 저주에 걸렸대요… 그래서 이곳에 오는 것조차 다들 꺼려했는데 <font color="#ffd200">그 언니</font>만큼은 달랐어요.
언니라면 누구를 말하는 것인지 물어본다.
$npcName:11001396[gender:1]$ 언니요. 언니가 나랑 새끼 손가락까지 꼭꼭 걸구 <font color="#ffd200">약속</font>했어요. 반드시 병을 치료할 방법을 찾아오겠다구요!
듣기론 $npc:11001443[gender:0]$도 치료할 방법이 마땅치 않았다고 말한다.
그렇지 않아요! $npcName:11001396[gender:1]$ 언니는 마을에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcTitle:11001396[gender:1]$</font>$pp:라고,이라고$ 불린다구요. 그런 언니가 <font color="#ffd200">약속</font>했다구요…
…$npcName:11001396[gender:1]$$pp:가,이$ 지금 어디에 있는지 물어본다.

혹시 그녀의 행방을 알만한 사람이 있는지 물어본다.
언니의 아빠인 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:11001390[gender:0]$</font> 아저씨가 <font color="#ffd200">미나르</font>에 살고 있어요. 아저씨에게 <font color="#ffd200">언니의 소식</font>을 물어보면…알 수 있지 않을까요?
언니의 아빠인 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:11001390[gender:0]$</font> 아저씨가 <font color="#ffd200">미나르</font>에 살고 있어요. 아저씨에게 <font color="#ffd200">언니의 소식</font>을 물어보면…알 수 있지 않을까요?

$npcName:11001396[gender:1]$$pp:는,은$ 제 <font color="#ffd200">딸</font>인데… 딸 아이에게 무슨 볼일이라도…?

녀석, 또 무슨 일로 나갔나 했더니…그런 <font color="#ffd200">약속</font>을…
$npcName:11001396[gender:1]$$pp:는,은$ 이미 $map:02010063$$pp:를,을$ 떠났습니다. 평소에도 워낙 유적지 관찰이나 연구를 좋아하는 녀석인지라… 이번에도 그런줄로만 알았는데 병을 치료할 방법을 찾겠다니…
무슨 문제라도 있는지 물어본다.
그런 약속을 한 것 자체가 문제가 아니고 뭐겠습니까? 어릴 적부터 신동으로 불리면서 몇몇 사람들이 천재라고 부르니… 어려운 문제라면 뭐든지 자신이 해결하겠다고 <font color="#ffd200">의욕</font>만 높은 녀석입니다.
물론 자만하는 나쁜 버릇이 있는 것은 아니지만… 자신이 모든 짐을 짊어지려는 경향이 있죠. 지금까지 해결하지 못한 문제는 없었기에 특별히 문제될 것은 없었다곤 해도…전 늘 <font color="#ffd200">걱정</font>입니다. 언제고 자신이 해결할 수 없는 <font color="#ffd200">큰 벽</font>이라도 마주하는 날엔…
어쨌거나 기왕 <font color="#ffd200">약속</font>을 했으니 자신이 한 말에는 <font color="#ffd200">책임</font>을 져야겠죠. …그저 이번에도 슬기롭게 해결할 수 있기를 바랄뿐입니다.

이것이 무엇인지 물어본다.
제가 만든 <font color="#ffd200">도시락</font>입니다. 밥이나 굶고 다니는 것은 아닌지 걱정이 돼서… 이런 거라도 만들지 않으면 제 마음이 편하지 못해서 말이죠. $npcName:11001396[gender:1]$$pp:를,을$ 만나면 꼭 좀 전해주십시오.
아직 $npcName:11001396[gender:1]$$pp:를,을$ 만나러 가지 않으셨군요. 무슨 문제라도 있으십니까?
받은 도시락을 잃어버렸다고 말한다.
아무것도 아니라고 말한다.

이곳엔 무슨 일로 왔죠?

$map:02010023$에 펼쳐진 거대한 유적지를 꾸준히 관찰해온 결과, 유적지 주변에서 출몰하는 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:21000674$</font>$pp:가,이$ 수상한 석판 조각을 들고 있는 것을 보았어요. 어쩌면 마을에 창궐한 괴이한 <font color="#ffd200">질병의 원인</font>이 $npcName:21000674$의 짓일지 <font color="#ffd200">의심</font>도 들고…

<font color="#ffd200">$npcName:11001397[gender:0]$</font>, $map:02010023$의 유적지를 조사하던 중에 만난 모로파파 부족원이죠. 그와 잠깐 $npcName:11001392[gender:1]$$pp:가,이$ 앓고있는 질병에 대해서 이야기를 나눈 적이 있었는데… 사정을 듣고 본인만의 연구를 해보겠다고 했어요.

벌써 돌아오셨군요! $npcName:11001397[gender:0]$$pp:와,과$ 만나보셨나요?
$npcName:11001397[gender:0]$에게서 받은 비약에 대해 이야기한다.

과연 그 $item:30000503$$pp:가,이$ 실마리였어요. 그것을 바탕으로 $npcName:11001397[gender:0]$$pp:가,이$ 만든 비약이라면 믿을 수 있겠죠. 드디어 $npcName:11001392[gender:1]$$pp:와의,과의$ <font color="#ffd200">약속</font>을 지킬 수 있겠군요.
기뻐보인다고 말한다.
그런가요? 드디어 $npcName:11001392[gender:1]$$pp:와의,과의$ 약속을 지킬 수 있겠다고 생각하니…저도 모르게…
이 소식을 들으면 $npcName:11001392[gender:1]$도 틀림없이 기뻐할 거라고 말한다.
역시, 그렇겠죠?! $map:02010005$에 있는 $npcName:11001392[gender:1]$에게 이 <font color="#ffd200">기쁜 소식</font>과 <font color="#ffd200">비약</font>을 전해주시겠어요? 저는 유적에 대한 기록을 정리해야할 것이 있어서 바로 움직일 수는 없을 것 같아요.
$npcName:11001392[gender:1]$$pp:를,을$ 만나보겠다고 말한다.
